channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: European markets set to start the week in mixed territory
item.description: European stocks are expected to start the new trading week in mixed territory.

item.title: Southeast Asia is a top choice for firms diversifying supply chains amid U.S.-China tensions
item.description: Rising tensions between Washington and Beijing have led firms to diversify supply chains away from China even as they maintain a presence in the country.

item.title: Nvidia-backed AI startup Synthesia now lets you make multilingual video presentations using just your phone or webcam
item.description: AI startup Synthesia debuted a slew of new features including the ability to make Apple-style presentations with avatars by using just a webcam or phone.

item.title: China wants EU to scrap planned higher tariffs and 'abide by WTO rules,' state media reports
item.description: Scrapping the tariff decision on Chinese EVs is set to benefit both sides, Global Times reported, quoting observers.

item.title: Nvidia remains a little-known brand despite briefly passing Apple, Microsoft in market cap
item.description: Even with its ascent past $3 trillion in market cap, Nvidia is far from a household name.

item.title: Experts say Shein's U.S. IPO is all but dead
item.description: Chances for a U.S. IPO for Shein are veering toward near-zero as American public officials take a tougher bipartisan stance on Chinese e-commerce platforms.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Dow posts best week since May, Tesla cuts 14% of workforce
item.description: Nvidia added a staggering $880 billion to its market cap, but shares fell almost 7%, wiping out more than $220 billion in value.

item.title: A B.A. from Columbia could cost $500,000: Here are the top 10 most expensive places in the U.S. to go college
item.description: Tuition isn't the only expense you'll need to cover during four years of college. These are the schools where it costs the most to study, live, eat and more.

item.title: Four self-made millionaires echo the same advice for success: Just get started
item.description: Jason McGowan, Anne Mahlum, Edward Tirtanata and Shawn Tsao have one thing in common — they're millionaire founders willing to sacrifice everything for a dream.

item.title: The stock market is in its longest stretch without a 2% sell-off since the financial crisis
item.description: Wall Street's rise to record highs has come with very little volatility.

item.title: China has spent at least $230 billion to build its EV industry, new study finds
item.description: China spent $230.8 billion over more than a decade to develop its electric car industry, according to the Center for Strategic and International Studies.

item.title: Singaporean swimmer Toh Wei Soong hopes for a medal in his second Paralympic bid
item.description: Singaporean para-athlete Toh Wei Soong will be fighting to medal in the Paralympics this year in Paris.

item.title: SoftBank CEO says AI that is 10,000 times smarter than humans will come out in 10 years
item.description: SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son laid out his vision for artifical super intelligence, or ASI, that he said would be 10,000 times smarter than humans.

item.title: 'Inside Out 2' adds ennui to its cast of emotions: How the feeling affects Gen Z workers, from a psychologist who worked on the film
item.description: Ennui is more consuming as a teenager, but it can play a role in the lives of young adults who are transitioning from school to the workforce.

item.title: Tesla internal data shows company has slashed at least 14% of workforce this year
item.description: Tesla internal records viewed by CNBC suggest the company employs just over 121,000 people, including temporary workers.

item.title: Apple Intelligence won't launch in EU in 2024 due to antitrust regulation, company says
item.description: Apple Intelligence and two other features won't be available in the European Union when they launch later in 2024, due to interoperability rules in the DMA.

item.title: How TikTok’s viral 'no-spend month' could come back to bite you
item.description: There is no substitute for establishing a budget you can sustain over time, financial experts say.

item.title: Move over, Tokyo. Hong Kong is now the most expensive city to build, survey shows
item.description: Hong Kong has surpassed Tokyo as Asia's most expensive city to build property amid a labor crunch and ageing population, according to a new market survey.

item.title: China talks up support for IPOs. Investors are watching the speed of approval
item.description: Chinese authorities this week announced new policy for supporting venture capital, raising hopes for faster approvals of initial public offerings.

item.title: I'm from Costa Rica: Here's what we eat every day for a long, healthy life—it's our 'secret to longevity'
item.description: "I have always felt that our diet and 'pura vida' lifestyle is our secret to longevity," writes Costa Rican cookbook author and teacher Melissa Guzman.

item.title: How the vodka soda became 'gay water'
item.description: The mixed alcoholic drink has become a cultural fixture that businesses are capitalizing on.

item.title: A relationship therapist picks the No.1 biggest dating mistake Gen Z is making
item.description: A relationship therapist told CNBC Make It that dating apps have made Gen Z extremely selective and reject potential partners for superficial reasons.

item.title: The No. 1 trait that sets highly successful people apart, says Harvard expert: 'It's rare to find'
item.description: Being open-minded isn’t just important for the job search. It can help you stand out in the workplace, says Harvard Business School professor Joseph Fuller.

item.title: Regulators hit Citigroup, JPMorgan Chase, Goldman Sachs and Bank of America over living will plans
item.description: The living wills are a key Federal Reserve and FDIC exercise mandated in the aftermath of the 2008 global financial crisis.

item.title: Starboard loses initial legal fight against Autodesk, but the battle may just be beginning
item.description: Autodesk will be allowed to hold its board vote next month after the Delaware Chancery Court rejected Starboard’s claim on June 20.

item.title: The planetary health diet may help you live a longer, healthier life, study shows—here's how it compares to the Mediterranean diet
item.description: Risk of premature death was 30% lower for people who ate a planet-friendly diet, according to a recent study. Here's what the diet entails.

item.title: Putin says Russia is ramping up its nuclear arsenal — and is open to security talks with NATO states
item.description: Russia is ready to hold security talks with NATO states, President Vladimir Putin said, while affirming Moscow's plans to ramp up the national nuclear arsenal.

item.title: This 30-year-old made $66,000 selling trash last year. His finds include Fendi bags and hundreds in cash
item.description: They say one man's trash is another man's treasure. Indeed, Leonardo Urbano made as much as $66,306 last year rummaging through rubbish piles in Sydney.

item.title: Human rights lawyer to political reformer: Who is Keir Starmer, the UK's new would-be prime minister
item.description: Labour leader Keir Starmer is the favorite to win the U.K.'s July 4 election.

item.title: China’s 618 e-commerce sales drop for the first time in 8 years, data firm Syntun says
item.description: The gross merchandise value of companies, or sales, during the shopping festival fell 7% from last year to 742.8 billion yuan ($102.3 billion).
